source_quote: inside the range of Displacement Low and Displacement High we must see some Fair Value Gaps there

signature.condition: IF price sweeps Sellside Liquidity below a low and breaks higher with momentum and displacement
signature.action: THEN look for Fair Value Gaps (FVG) between Displacement High and Displacement Low as confirmation of a Bullish Market Structure Shift (MSS)
signature.drawer_basis: ICT explicitly taught this as Market Structure Shift pattern

source_quote: price runs the Buyside Liquidity and into a 15min and or 60min POI like a FVG or a Bearish –Orderblock, reject it and reprice lower very sharply leaving imbalance

signature.condition: IF price runs Buyside Liquidity and rallies into a Higher Timeframe (HTF) PDA like a Bearish Order Block or FVG
signature.action: THEN look for a sharp rejection and energetic move below the Displacement Low, leaving imbalance
signature.drawer_basis: ICT explicitly taught this as Bearish Market Structure Shift pattern

source_quote: price will simply just push higher above the old high to sweep the Buyside Liquidity and continue lower

signature.condition: IF price runs liquidity and reverses during a Lower Timeframe (LTF) move but the Higher Timeframe (HTF) is still directional
signature.action: THEN expect price to continue in the HTF direction, trapping early buyers or sellers
signature.drawer_basis: ICT explicitly taught this as a trap scenario in Market Structure Shifts

source_quote: price on the Lower TF’s right after the NY Midnight Open runs below the AR Low into a 15/60min Bullish PDA and then gives a clear 5min Market Structure Shift Higher

signature.condition: IF price runs below the AR Low into a 15/60min Bullish PDA during the London Killzone (LOKZ)
signature.action: THEN look for a clear 5min Market Structure Shift Higher with imbalance as confirmation of a potential Low Of The Day (LOTD)
signature.drawer_basis: ICT explicitly taught this as a Bullish Market Structure Shift scenario

source_quote: if we’re not 100% sure about the low price formed + there’s an opposing PDA like FVG there on the right – we wait for more confirmation

signature.condition: IF price forms a Liquidity Pool at the Displacement High and there are opposing Higher Timeframe (HTF) PDA’s
signature.action: THEN wait for more confirmation or a second retracement to determine if it’s a trap or a valid Market Structure Shift
signature.drawer_basis: ICT explicitly taught this as a confirmation requirement for Market Structure Shifts

source_quote: if DXY runs the BSLQ and goes lower but EURUSD fails to do that and instead forms a higher low instead of a lower low (SMT) and then we see a quick move higher – that’s our Market Structure Shift (MSS

signature.condition: IF DXY runs Buyside Liquidity and goes lower but EURUSD forms a higher low instead of a lower low (SMT Divergence)
signature.action: THEN look for a quick move higher in EURUSD as confirmation of a Market Structure Shift (MSS)
signature.drawer_basis: ICT explicitly taught this as SMT Divergence confirmation for Market Structure Shifts

source_quote: price moves slowly towards the 60min FVG, then sharply drops below an old low into 60min FVG and goes parabolic from there

signature.condition: IF price moves slowly towards a 60min FVG and sharply drops below an old low into the FVG
signature.action: THEN expect a parabolic move higher targeting Buyside Liquidity
signature.drawer_basis: ICT explicitly taught this as a high-probability Market Structure Shift scenario

source_quote: refining a BPR inside this sharp Stop Run followed by quick displacement higher that gives MSS is a very high probability area

signature.condition: IF price forms a Balanced Price Range (BPR) inside the Displacement High/Low range after a sharp Stop Run and displacement
signature.action: THEN refine the area using unconventional timeframes (e.g., 8min/10min) and look for overlapping confluence as a high-probability area
signature.drawer_basis: ICT explicitly taught this as a refinement technique for Market Structure Shifts
